title: Morgan Schneiderlin reveals his biggest regret under Jose Mourinho at Man Utd
text:
Morgan Schneiderlin spent less than two seasons at Manchester United before joining Everton (Getty Images)

Morgan Schneiderlin admits he lacked the patience to be a success under Jose Mourinho at Manchester United.

The 29-year-old was signed from Southampton for around £25 million but spent less than two years at Old Trafford before he was sold to Everton.

The French midfielder made 39 appearances during his first season under Louis van Gaal but struggled to keep his place in the side following Mourinho’s arrival a year after he joined.

‘With Mourinho I never had any problem. He was a managed I enjoyed working under,’ Schneiderlin told Sky Sports.

‘He came after a time with Van Gaal where I played 40 games and I was in the Euro [with France].

Schneiderlin featured frequently during Louis van Gaal’s reign at United (AFP/Getty Images)

‘I then had a week before the season started and I didn’t really have a proper pre-season.

‘And with Mourinho he was clear he said he’s worked with a lot of midfield players, he said to me he likes me as a footballer but that he knows some players in my position more because he had a pre-season with them, so that was not a problem.

‘I was a bit too impatient, I think, when I wanted to leave because after three or four months I was getting frustrated and everything.

‘But it was something I learned and he’s a manager with a lot of knowledge on football. He’s someone who I liked.

‘It was a pleasure to play for Man United. After that, maybe I should have had more chances but maybe I should have told myself, keep working, keep working, it will come’.

‘I use the example of Ander Herrera, under Van Gaal he didn’t play for three or four months, but he kept patient, he played with Mourinho and got his move to Paris Saint-Germain.

‘So sometimes in football you need to be patient and work.’
